title: 109_hr2319
content: SECTION 1. EXPENSING OF PROPERTY ELIGIBLE FOR BONUS DEPRECIATION. The subsection (k) of section 168 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to allow for 100 percent depreciation deduction for qualified property placed in service after May 12, 2005. The adjusted basis of the property is reduced by the deduction before computing the allowable amount. The subsection (k) of section 168 of the Internal Revenue Code allows for 100 percent depreciation deduction for qualified property with a recovery period of 20 years or less, computer software, water utility property, or qualified leasehold improvement property. The subsection (k) of section 168 of the Internal Revenue Code allows for 100 percent depreciation deduction for qualified property with a recovery period of 20 years or less, computer software, water utility property, or qualified leasehold improvement property. Qualified property includes property acquired after May 12, 2005, with no prior written contract, and certain aircraft used for agricultural or firefighting purposes. The subsection (k) of section 168 of the Internal Revenue Code allows for 100 percent depreciation deduction for qualified property with a recovery period of 20 years or less, computer software, water utility property, or qualified leasehold improvement property. Qualified property includes certain aircraft used for agricultural or firefighting purposes, with specific criteria for eligibility. Technical amendments are also made to section 168(k) of the Code. The amendments to section 168(k) of the Internal Revenue Code include changes to subparagraphs (C), (D), (E), and (F), redesignating clauses and adjusting monetary amounts. The effective date of these amendments is specified. The amendments to section 168(k) of the Internal Revenue Code, including changes to subparagraphs (C), (D), (E), and (F), will apply to property placed in service after May 12, 2005. SEC. 2 amends section 168(k)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code to apply the percentage of completion method for long-term contract accounting. SEC. 3 allows an election to increase the minimum tax credit limitation instead of bonus depreciation. The amendment allows corporations to increase the limitation under subsection (c) by an amount equal to the bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year. The bonus depreciation amount is calculated as 35 percent of the excess of the aggregate depreciation under section 167. The amendment allows corporations to increase the limitation under subsection (c) by an amount equal to the bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year. This election excludes property from Section 168(k) and can only be revoked with the Secretary's consent. The credit increase is refundable. The amendment allows corporations to increase the limitation under subsection (c) by the bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year. This election excludes property from Section 168(k) and can only be revoked with the Secretary's consent. The credit increase is refundable. The credit allowed by this section for any taxable year by reason of this subsection shall be treated as a credit allowed to the taxpayer under subpart C. Conforming Amendments include a cross-reference for an election to claim certain minimum tax credits in lieu of the allowance determined under this subsection. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for taxable years ending after May 12, 2005.
